steps.title: Press and hold the Power button for 20 seconds.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button for 20 seconds. [1] X Research source Release after the 20 seconds has passed. This action should turn the Nook off. A soft reset is recommended when the device becomes unresponsive or refuses to charge. This is a way to essentially refresh your Nook.

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button for two seconds to turn it back on.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button for two seconds to turn it back on. Upon start up of the Nook, you should find it functioning properly again.br> Should the device continue to be unresponsive, you will need to consider other methods of troubleshooting, such as a factory reset.

steps.title: Consider whether you want to complete the hard reset.
steps.content: Consider whether you want to complete the hard reset. A hard reset is different from a factory reset in that it does not completely wipe your Nook of your content and data. It is only recommended in the following scenarios: [2] X Research source Your Nook is not charging. Your Nook is unresponsive but powered on. You are asked to perform a hard reset by a customer service professional.

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button for 20 seconds.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button for 20 seconds. Use a watch, timer, or clock to help you track the time. When 20 seconds pass, release the Power button. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Press and release the Power button to restart your Nook.
steps.content: Press and release the Power button to restart your Nook. [4] X Research source Allow it to start up completely before trying to use it.

steps.title: Remove the Nook's battery, as an alternative option to Steps 2 and 3 above.
steps.content: Remove the Nook's battery, as an alternative option to Steps 2 and 3 above. This is another way to do a hard reset on your Nook 1st Edition. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Leave the battery out of the device for 10 seconds.
steps.content: Leave the battery out of the device for 10 seconds. After 10 seconds pass, replace the batter in the Nook. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Restart your Nook.
steps.content: Restart your Nook. [7] X Research source Press and release the Power button to restart it and allow it to boot up complete before trying to use it.

steps.title: Consider whether you really need or want to do a factory reset.
steps.content: Consider whether you really need or want to do a factory reset. This process reverts your Nook to factory settings, so you will lose all data saved to it. This is likely what you want to do if you are selling your Nook, but if that is not your plan, only do this if you are advised by a professional that you have no other option. It is recommended that if you are keeping the device, you back up your files before resetting to factory settings. The easiest way to do this is to download the Nook Reading App to your PC. The app will then sync with your Nook when you log into your account, thus storing your Nook Library on your PC. You can find the app in Apple's App Store, in Google Play, and in Windows Store. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Connect to a Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect to a Wi-Fi network. You cannot complete a factory reset without being connected to a Wi-Fi network. It is best to connect to your own private network, but it can be done on a public network, as the information should be encrypted by Barnes and Noble's system.

steps.title: Tap Settings from the Home menu.
steps.content: Tap Settings from the Home menu. [9] X Research source From here, you will be able to access the settings that will allow you to begin the process of doing a factory reset on your Nook 1st Edition.

steps.title: Go to Devices, and then tap Unregister Your Nook.
steps.content: Go to Devices, and then tap Unregister Your Nook. [10] X Research source Once you confirm this step, your account and information will be unregistered from the Nook.

steps.title: Click Confirm to unregister your Nook.
steps.content: Click Confirm to unregister your Nook. [11] X Research source As of now, your Nook has been cleared of your registration and account.

steps.title: Tap Reset to Factory Settings.
steps.content: Tap Reset to Factory Settings. After this, you will have to confirm twice. Once the process completes, your Nook will be completely cleared of all of your content and settings. It will be as it was the day you purchased it.

steps.title: Register your Nook again by following the on-screen prompts.
steps.content: Register your Nook again by following the on-screen prompts. [12] X Research source This applies only if you are keeping your Nook and had to do a factory reset to resolve a software issue.

steps.title: Think about whether you truly need to do a factory reset.
steps.content: Think about whether you truly need to do a factory reset. Doing so resets your Nook to factory settings, so you will lose all data saved to it. This is a standard procedure if you are selling your Nook, but if you are keeping your Nook, only do this if you are advised by a professional that you have no other option. If you are keeping your Nook, it is recommended that you back up your files before resetting to factory settings. The easiest way to do this is to download the Nook Reading App to your PC. The app will then sync with your Nook when you log into your account, thus storing your Nook Library on your PC. You can find the app in Apple's App Store, in Google Play, and in Windows Store. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Connect to a Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect to a Wi-Fi network. You cannot perform a factory reset without being connected to a Wi-Fi network. It is best to connect to a private network, but it can be done on a public network, as the information should be encrypted by Barnes and Noble's system.

steps.title: Select the Home, or 'n,' button on your Nook.
steps.content: Select the Home, or 'n,' button on your Nook. [14] X Research source This will bring up the quick navigation menu from which you will navigate into your Settings.

steps.title: Push Settings in the quick navigation bar.
steps.content: Push Settings in the quick navigation bar. [15] X Research source Once you are in the Settings menu, you will be able to start the process of performing the factory reset.

steps.title: Tap Device Information in the Settings menu.
steps.content: Tap Device Information in the Settings menu. [16] X Research source The option to reset your Nook to factory settings is inside this sub-menu.

steps.title: Click Erase & Deregister Device.
steps.content: Click Erase & Deregister Device. Then, you will confirm this selection by tapping Reset Nook. [17] X Research source At this point, your Nook should go through the process of restoring to its original factory settings. All of your settings and content will be removed from the device.

steps.title: Register your Nook again by following the prompts that appear after it resets.
steps.content: Register your Nook again by following the prompts that appear after it resets. [18] X Research source This applies only if you are keeping your Nook and had to do a factory reset to resolve a software issue.

steps.title: Determine whether a factory reset is necessary.
steps.content: Determine whether a factory reset is necessary. Doing so reverts your Nook to factory settings, so you will lose all data you had saved to it. This is expected if you plan to sell your Nook, but if you are not selling it, only do this if you are advised by a professional that you have no other option for fixing a problem. If you are keeping it, it is recommended that you back up your files before resetting to factory settings. The easiest way to do this is to download the Nook Reading App to your PC. The app will then sync with your Nook when you log into your account, thus storing your Nook Library on your PC. You can find the app in Apple's App Store, in Google Play, and in Windows Store. [19] X Research source On the Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 Nook, doing a factory reset will reset the entire tablet, not just your Nook account. This means that your Samsung account and any other accounts, settings, and content on your Galaxy Tab will be lost when you factory reset. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Connect to a Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect to a Wi-Fi network. You cannot perform a factory reset without being connected to a Wi-Fi network. It is best to connect to your private network.

steps.title: Pull down the Notifications panel from the top of the Tab's screen.
steps.content: Pull down the Notifications panel from the top of the Tab's screen. [21] X Research source This involves a simple swipe downward with your finger from the very top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the Settings icon, which looks like a gear.
steps.content: Tap the Settings icon, which looks like a gear. Once you have navigated into the Settings menu, you then need to click on the General option. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Select Backup and Restore in the left panel that appears.
steps.content: Select Backup and Restore in the left panel that appears. [23] X Research source From here, you will be able to go on to the next step of officially beginning the process to factory reset your Tab.

steps.title: Click Factory Data Reset in the right panel that appears next.
steps.content: Click Factory Data Reset in the right panel that appears next. Then, complete the process by tapping Reset Device. [24] X Research source Your device will go through the process of restoring to factory settings, erasing all of your content and settings from it.

steps.title: Power off your Nook tablet.
steps.content: Power off your Nook tablet. This is an option that saves you the time of tapping through various screens and selecting different options, as you do in the methods above. This method will not work for the Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 Nook.

steps.title: Hold the Power button and the Home button ('n') simultaneously.
steps.content: Hold the Power button and the Home button ('n') simultaneously. Together, these buttons will start to reboot your Nook once it has powered down.

steps.title: Release the Power and Home buttons.
steps.content: Release the Power and Home buttons. Wait to release the buttons until you see the word "nook" appear on the screen.

steps.title: Follow the prompts to reset your nook.
steps.content: Follow the prompts to reset your nook. The factory reset menu will appear. Just follow the instructions to do a reset. Press Power to exit, or press Home to continue.

steps.title: Confirm the reset.
steps.content: Confirm the reset. A new message will appear on your screen asking if you are sure and explaining that you will lose all content on your device. [25] X Research source Press Power to exit, or press Home to continue.

steps.title: Complete the process of restoring your device to factory settings.
steps.content: Complete the process of restoring your device to factory settings. You can re-register and set up your device when you are done, if you are keeping it.
